main event: In November 1957, near Canadian, Texas, a witness driving alone spotted an object approximately 100 feet in diameter, emitting a reddish-orange glow and traveling at 300-400 mph, hovering momentarily and then disappearing from view.
interesting points: The object was observed to rise from the ground and proceed on a flight path without losing altitude or slowing its speed.
No sound was heard despite the object being relatively close to the witness.
The witness was a credible individual, a pilot named John F. Stanley.
The sighting lasted for approximately 2-3 minutes, allowing for detailed observation of the object.
The report classified the information as 'CONFIDENTIAL' due to its nature.
sighted object: a large circular object emitting a reddish-orange glow
